Interface SampleLossFunction

All Superinterfaces:
LossFunction
All Known Implementing Classes:
MeanError, ScaledError, SummedError
@DomainObject @Strategy(INTERFACE) public interface SampleLossFunction extends LossFunction
Represents a loss function that operates at the per-sample level.

A sample loss aggregates the losses of individual output dimensions (dimension losses, l) into a single per-sample loss (L), which can then be used to compute batch-level loss (J) in BatchLossFunction.

Definitions:

  • Sample loss (L): the aggregated loss for a single training sample.
  • Gradient dL/dl: the derivative of the sample loss with respect to each dimension loss, used for backpropagation from the sample to individual dimensions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    float
    calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions)
    Computes the gradient of the sample loss with respect to the individual dimension losses.
    float
    calculateSampleLoss(List<Float> dimensionLosses)
    Calculates the total loss for a single sample by aggregating the losses of its dimensions.

  • Method Details

    • calculateSampleLoss

      float calculateSampleLoss(List<Float> dimensionLosses)
      Calculates the total loss for a single sample by aggregating the losses of its dimensions.
      Parameters:
      dimensionLosses - a list of losses for each output dimension
      Returns:
      the total sample loss

    • calculateGradient_dL_dl

      float calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions)
      Computes the gradient of the sample loss with respect to the individual dimension losses. This corresponds to dL/dl in backpropagation equations.
      Parameters:
      dimensions - the number of output dimensions
      Returns:
      the gradient of the sample loss with respect to each dimension loss
